Text: Haaah!!!
Ngh...! Her strikes are both hard and precise!

Not bad, but you inquisitor style is
fundamentally weak!

A style meant to rob the body of freedom is also one
designed to avoid taking life by mistake—

So, if you were to try to land a fatal blow, your
movement would be deviating from the original
intent of the technique, and thus create an opening!

Twisting swordplay away from its original purpose,
killing the enemy, has made each of your techniques
slower and weaker!

Omega's right... 93's swordsmanship is meant to
break an opponent, not kill them.

The dead tell no tales, so any good inquisitor would
want to keep their target able to speak, and so here
we are!
Nnf...!

So, what's it going to be? You're free to yield
whenever you like—
93! Stop fooling around!
What...?!

I know you were probably just trying to get a read
on her, but Omega isn't a foe to poke at with your
inquisitor techniques!
Use your Garden style! Bring her to her knees!
...Understood.
So you've been toying with me?
Now that is just the tiniest bit annoying...
Careful, Omega, Garden techniques are—
Chi! Stay out of this!
...Understood.
...Hah!
*gasp*
Urgh...!
She hits fast...and hard!
H-Her attacks are so basic!

And yet it's all you can do to block them, right?
That is the essence of Shadow Garden swordsmanship.

Do away with the extraneous, and utilize one's innate
magic and training to the fullest—

It's unquestionably a featureless, simple style
focused solely on defeating the enemy...

But having that as a foundation allows for all manner
of tactical variety!
If you're keeping your moves simple...!

Hoping to crush me from a distance with a battle
axe, are you?
Shortsighted.
Grrr... Damn you!

If she can stop you from a distance with a hail of
blades, that pretty much nullifies any advantages
of weapon range...

A feat only a slime sword is capable of, one with
truly limitless possibilities... How will you
respond, Omega?!
It ends here—
We'll see about that!
*gasp*!

Oh dear... That was a perfect chance you had there.
What made you forgo the advantage and keep your
distance?

...Because the moment I plunged in thinking I had the
advantage, it was then I found you had immobilized
me, and were ready to deal a killing blow.

When you pierced the ground with the shaft of your
axe, you made a show of leaving yourself open, but you
were in fact sending your slime quietly burrowing
beneath the earth.

So, she went for a ruse to try to reverse her
predicament. Her composure and focus under
pressure are back on full display.

This has been quite the wake-up call! A reminder to
not underestimate anyone in the Shadow Garden.

Even just the rank and file are formidable! I won't
make light of you again...so let's continue the
fight!
That's enough! Lower your blades, both of you!
Hey! Zinaida!

If you've come to your senses, then there's no more
need to continue this "farce" as you called it any
further, now is there?
What?! Y-You...!

Haha, well, Omega, looks like Lambda wins this
round. She forced you to get serious.
Chi! Don't act like you weren't involved!
Nicely fought, Lady Omega.

I look forward to more of your guidance and
encouragement.
Wha... R-Really?

You must be joking... I mean, you're more used to all
this than I am, no? It feels almost like it's you who
should be teaching me.

Yes, you may be right. That's part of the reason why
I took this opportunity to introduce myself formally.
Hey!

...I have to hand it to you Lambda, your golden child
here is a real piece of work.

Now, as for the Garden's—or rather Master Shadow's—
swordsmanship, I want you to teach me everything...
That'll be a good start.

Yeah. I need to focus and learn the Garden's style as
well.

That's the spirit. We'll strengthen our skill and
unity as Numbers in one blow!

—And that's all there is to tell. It was a painful
reminder of my own inexperience.

(So, a strange statue transformed into a guardian that
looked just like her and blocked the way... A pretty
by-the-books course of events.)

(Catching a sword between your bare hands...
It's about as epic a move as it gets. And then
if you're able to snap the blade after you catch
it...chef's kiss.)

(...But if anything, it falls more into that category
of desperation moves that you whip out to instantly
turn the tables.)

(But if you don't stop the other guy's sword with
your hands, you're dead, end of story... The question
is, is getting back into a dangerous spot like that a
good thing or a bad thing?)

(But if you're a shadowbroker, part of taking the
situation into account would also be never placing
oneself in those kinds of white-knuckle spots to
begin with, huh?)

(So, in that sense, catching a sword in your bare
hands could be said to be a textbook main character
move.)

But Alpha does have a lot of the traits of a main
character... And if you look at how the story always
goes, she pretty much already is one.
Cid...?
Oh, uh, nothing—
(...Hold up. Let's flip the script.)

(If catching the sword is what the main character
does, then breaking out of the sword-catch could
work as a shadowbroker move!)

(...Like what does a shadowbroker do when the other
guy catches his sword?)
(Hell yeah! Now THIS is a super interesting theme!)

(And this is Alpha we're talking about here, so she
probably already has an understanding of catching
swords from taking on Beta and the crew, even if it's
just for their little Shadow Garden games!)
...Alpha. We're going to do some sword training now.
Huh... Now, as in right here?

That's right. Time is of the essence, so we'll begin
right away.

...Okay, I understand! I'll be your partner until
you're satisfied.

(There's no art in just regrowing the sword from
slime after it breaks. So, then what's the best move
to follow up with...?)

Heehee... This reminds me of old times, when it was
just the two us practicing together—
